title: NIO ADR Weekly News Summary
body:
**Financial Performance:**

- **Q3 2025 Earnings:** NIO reported a net loss of RMB 3.48 billion ($490 million) for Q3 2025, marking a 31.2% year-over-year decrease. Revenue reached RMB 21.79 billion ($3.06 billion), a 16.7% increase from the previous year, though it fell short of analyst expectations. Gross margin improved to 13.9% from 10.7% a year earlier. ([cnevpost.com](https://cnevpost.com/2025/11/25/nio-earnings-q3-2025/?utm_source=openai))

- **Q4 2025 Guidance:** The company projects vehicle deliveries between 120,000 and 125,000 units, below the previously stated target of 150,000 units. ([cnevpost.com](https://cnevpost.com/2025/11/25/nio-earnings-q3-2025/?utm_source=openai))

**Market Reaction:**

- Following the earnings release, NIO's stock experienced a decline of approximately 4.4%, closing at $5.50. ([en.tmtpost.com](https://en.tmtpost.com/post/7782543?utm_source=openai))

**Legal Developments:**

- Singapore's sovereign wealth fund, GIC, filed a lawsuit against NIO, alleging accounting irregularities related to the recognition of battery sales earnings. ([nasdaq.com](https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/investment-case-nio-stock-it-faces-gic-lawsuit?utm_source=openai))

key_dates.title: Q3 2025 Earnings Report
key_dates.importance_for_price: The earnings report revealed a significant reduction in net loss and an improvement in gross margin, which could positively influence investor sentiment.

key_dates.title: Q4 2025 Guidance Announcement
key_dates.importance_for_price: The revised delivery guidance below previous targets may raise concerns about future growth, potentially impacting stock performance.

key_dates.title: GIC Lawsuit Filing
key_dates.importance_for_price: The lawsuit alleging accounting irregularities could negatively affect investor confidence and stock price.

key_points.text: NIO reported a reduced net loss and improved gross margin in Q3 2025, but revenue fell short of expectations.
The company lowered its Q4 2025 delivery guidance, indicating potential challenges in meeting previous targets.
A lawsuit filed by GIC alleging accounting irregularities may impact investor confidence.
